content: these woodland fingerless mitts are the perfect staple to those chilly days where warmth and style are a must this pattern is designed to have a longer sleeve that can scrunch up if desired to give a relaxed fit and look youtube step-by-step tutorial will be available on my page pineneedleknits please note the mitts pictured here are using a self-striping yarn this pattern does not require more than 1 skein of yarn yarn 50 grams fingering weight yarn needles 2 25mm us 1 double pointed needles gauge 15 sts/24 row = 2x2 inches 5x5 cm in blocked stockinette this pattern is knitted in the round on double pointed needles
